message:
In this case (where a ComboBox is being used as a compact representation of multiple buttons), I personally would remove the CB data-binding and just handle the changed event. If you do want/need to retain the CB data-binding, then you could handle the property-changed event for the property it's bound to.

In either case, to kick off the async operation, you should call NotifyTask.Create. Note that the *starting* of an asynchronous operation is itself synchronous, so there should be no problem there.

If this doesn't answer your question, please post a Gist or a question on SO, send me the link, and I'll take a look.
